rComments: He speak really well and slow but unfortunately the class were recorded in advanced and sometimes theres not much informations for when it comes to the exam. You have 40 mins for each exam but it doesnt give you time to analyse the sentence so it makes it hard and stressfull. Im usually a A+ student but this class was a real pain.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lots of homework', 'Tough grader', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Si le français est ta première langue, tu passera facilement. Par contre, il faut toujours bien se preparer pour ses tests parce que le temps est très limité. Les projets sont faits en groupes et c'est lui qui choisi les groupes.

Prof trop stricte pour des sujets dépassés. Un programme qui date des années 90 pour un monde entièrement numérique. N'est pas de ressort, mais trop sévère pour une matière futile. J'ai absolument rien appris de sa matière, anglicisme ne s'appliquant absolument pas au français de France et des pays africains. N'utiliserais jamais çà en vrai.

Le cours était asynchrone. Il y avait deux exam de vrai/faux (difficiles), deux rédactions en équipe de 5 (faciles) et une rédaction finale. Le prof envoyait des vidéos monotones et ennuyants et il fallait prendre nos notes à partir de ceux-ci. Sa réponse à tout les courriels était ''Je l'ai dit dans le vidéo, va l'écouter''. Bien à vous.
teacherRatingTags: ['Group projects', 'Gives good feedback', 'Graded by few things']

rComments: LE COURS EST TRES INTERESSANT J'AI APPRIS BEACOUP DE CHOSES. MAIS LE PROF EST TRES TRES TROP DUR DANS LA CORRECTION ET SES COURS NE REFLETE PAS DU TOUT SES EXAMENS QUI SONT VRAIMENT DUR. J AI JAMAIS TROUVE UN COURS DE FRANCAIS AUSSI DUR QUE LE SIEN
Good class
So bad avoid at all costs, this course messed up my gpa the material is not enough to prepare for the tests and the grading is tough

I was disappointed by the class, its inconsequential course material, and the rather lethargic professors. M. Erfani, frowns upon student asking him for help. His course work is uninspiring and does not reflect the exam whatsoever. He's a tough grader,as the smallest of error like minor spacing problems can be the difference between an A and a A+

This year the whole course was graded on two multiple choice test and two group projects. The tests were extremely difficult especially for the minimal amount of information given on the topics. They were pretty much impossible to prepare for and his videos were a snooze fest. Luckily the final exam was really easy.

He was an okay prof. Seems like online wasn't his strength. He's pretty straightforward but he does not budge if we ask him to change something. He refused to let us submit projects via PDF/JPG and instead had to write it through brightspace , which completely RUINS the format and he heavily grades the format). Anglicism test was way to tricky.

He seems like a good professor in person, but he's a whole lot different online. Group projects are heavily graded on formatting, and he refused students to submit the assignment in PDF. Instead he wants us to submit on Brightspace, where all the formatting changes when submitting. The tests were multiple choice and seemed to be all trick questions

I could write an essay on how bad my experience in this class was. Seriously, it looks like he was good in person, but online, man was he absolutely horrible. It really felt like he was trying to be as unclear as possible. The guy would give close to no details and the tests, don't even get me started. We couldn't go back to revise at the end...

It was an asynchronous class. The tests were all multiple choice and they were almost all trick questions even though the material was supposed to be easy (basic grammar). Group projects were heavily graded on formatting but he made us submit using Brightspace which reformatted all of the text when pasted; he refused to use PDF instead.

This class was suuper easy. If you show up and participate you're golden. Erfani just reads straight from the workbook (make sure you buy the right one) and does the activities in there and teaches some grammar. 2 midterms, a short written assignment, a 5min presentation, and exam. The only bad thing is he doen't give any marks back to you. Ever.

M. Erfani is an awesome prof. He cares a lot about his students and wants them to do well. He provides clear grading criteria and detailed rubrics. The classes are based on the textbook so you have to get it and come to class (also - participation marks!). The class is pretty grammar-based but he makes it clear. Overall, highly recommend this prof.
Engaging in lectures ! Super easy to participate in this class and very reasonable grading
teacherRatingTags: ['Clear grading criteria', 'Accessible outside class', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: Professor Erfani taught his class very openly and often, due to its size, will help every individual student, similar to your typical high school course. His assignments and tests are very straightforward and gives clear expectations for his students. He is very caring and loves to say "s-v-p". Overall, a great guy and a great class.

Mr. Erfani is very kind and respectful. He treats us as adults and is very patient. The textbook he used is very cheap (about 10$). I would say he did go fast on the material and the grammar notion, but they were difficult in themselves.

He's very kind and cares for all the students. He speaks very clearly and the classes and very much discussion based, which I love because it allows us to practice French oral skills. There is no homework in his class, just 2 tests, a presentation, and a final. Definitely recommend taking his class if you want to improve your French!

Erfani is a very patient and respectful guy. He really cares for each one of his students. Always makes you feel comfortable and answers any questions you have with ease. There is almost no work for this course; besides 2, 150 word papers and a 2 min ppt presentation; but attendance is mandatory. Legit an easy A+ . Highly recommend this guy :D
This man is beautiful. He finds the most elegant ways to convey his messages. Is very kind and loves to say "S'il vous plaît."
S'il vous plaît.
Very nice person and more importantly offers a well structured course. Each class you'll have the opportunity to practice your oral, writing and reading comprehension.

Most AMAZING professor. He is so sweet and caring, speaks very clearly and has clear expectations of his students. He wants everyone to succeed and does not judge people. Attendance is mandatory as it is a language class, but there is no homework. Only 1 assignment, 1 midterm and 1 final. I recommend anyone looking to learn french to take his class

Best French professor I've ever had. Very interactive and goes above and beyond to assure all his students succeed. 3 hour Tuesday morning lectures but he always lets you leave early. Very precise in what he wants regarding projects but makes you pay attention to detail. Does the exercises with you in class and an overall nice guy. Highly recommend

His classes are once a week for 3 hours. The purpose of the course is to learn how to write a rapport de rédaction but you're never even given a written structure. He'll talk about it in great detail and tell you all the notes are online but the ones that are aren't detailed enough. I was basically self taught from the examples in the 'textbook'.

Easily the best French professor I have ever had. Speaks very clearly, is very supportive and understanding (especially when you have a million questions or if you make mistakes) and is very kind. The course is very well-structured with useful exercises in each French skill on useful topics (ex. university life). Could not recommend enough.
Son cours est très ennuyant. Il est très monotone et stricte. Toutefois c'est un A+ garantie si vous êtes bon en grammaire.  Soyez près au par cœur!

Un enseignant vraiment merveilleux.  Il possède la capabilité de rendre les cours très captivants et informatifs, et sa manière d'enseigner est superbe, très concise.  Les tests ne sont pas façiles, et il est vraiment nécessaire de venir à tous les cours et de faire les exemples en classe afin de bien comprendre.  Excellent prof!

He does things really strictly and is really "square"(strict on attendance, you can only use pens on quizzes and final exam, strict if you hand in something late...). other than that hes an amazing prof. he speaks clearly, lets you leave early, and he's really funny. I feel like he's an interesting person and i definitely would take his class again

If you don't participate he targets you and you feel like he hates you for the whole class. No one understands what he says and he strict rules for handing in reports. Only good thing about his class is that there's no midterms
Il est vraiment excellent! Il connait et explique très bien la matière. Il s'exprime aussi vraiment bien.

Amazing professor. Speaks very clearly so that even I (who was 3yrs rusty in French) could understand. Tests were straightforward. Extremely charming and pleasant. Notes and clear and easy to follow. Be prepared to participate in class.
Best professor ever!  Very organized class structure, and very accessible in terms of help with course material and assignments. Would definitely recommend!

Excellent prof! Il connait très bien sa matière et il veut aider ses étudiants. Les diapos sont en ligne. Beaucoup de tests donc il est difficile de manquer des cours, mais les tests sont faciles. Aucun projet, pas d'examen mi-session. Cours vraiment facile.

100% recommend. He is the nicest man who is easy to confront if you have a problem. He is a fair marker, if you show up you'll get an A. Take his course, its a stress reliever because of the little amount of work he gives out. When tested he'll tell you EXACTLY what to study and the midterms and exams are pretty much done in a group anyways.

Erfani is just a super nice guy.  He smiles a lot and really makes you feel comfortable in his class. I was really nervous about speaking French in front of a group, but he made my fears disappear.  I really enjoyed having him as a prof and I would definitely recommend taking his class!
Wonderful Professor. He genuinely cares about the success of all of his students. This course requires class attendance and diligent work, but he makes every class fun and worthwhile.

He's a very good prof. Lectures are not too long and he understands that students get tired of listening after a while. He seems to care about his students like many say. At first, I didn't fully understand what we were being taught, but it got much clearer towards the end of the course with the project. Just go with the flow, you'll be fine.

I have this prof at Carleton and he is easily one of my favorites. He seems to genuinely care about the success of his students and will go out of his way to ensure everyone is reaching their full potential.

The class itself doesn't have much content but the prof is good. He cares for his students, speaks very well and is quite straight forward with what he wants. He takes attendance in FRA1538 so show up unless you want to lose 10%. My lecture was 3 hours but he let us out early almost every time so it really wasn't that bad!

Great professor. Really cares about his students and is always there to help you out. Professor Erfani is encouraging and helpful, will often only let class run for about 2 hours with a 10 minute break! He is a very understanding professor and tends to be mindful of students' stress and workload. One of the best professors I have ever had.

He is a very kind man. He seems to genuinely care about his students and their success. He's really into participation though, so be sure to attend classes and do your homework. Especially since he doesn't give that much of it. It was an okay class.

Personally, I wouldn't recommend taking his class. He is very condescending, why beats me. I have never felt so disrespected by a  professor in my entire university career. I don't know if he just didn't like me as a person or my accent but nepotsim in his grading is to be expected.
Best Teacher ever!! Easy class, no midterms, 7 tests, that way you can make up if you didn't do well in one. I totally recommend it!
The kindest professor ever. He's very polite and respectful. He makes everyone feel happy comfortable. He's always fair in terms of grading and his exams are not difficult.
Such a sweet prof, very approachable and helpful.  He is great at explaining things and makes sure that everyone is doing well.  Very good teacher, I would highly recommend him!
amazing class
